intro: Triumfetta dioica, commonly known as the common triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and wastelands. Triumfetta dioica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
